addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

29 Junij
1591
. M
r
Bodeley to my L. from Leewarden.
Collonel Senoy
./

page.lettertext:
fol.172r
May it please yo
r
good L. The letter whiche yo
w
writte in
e favo
r
of Mons
r
Sonoy, bearing date
from
e court
e 25 of May, came but nowe unto
my handes: and likewise that letter, w
ch
was
written by her
Ma
tie
to
e
states of Holland
, in
Ja
n
last, was almost three monethes in
e way,
before it was delivered. It was therein signified,
that I had bin required to solicit
at cause. But I
had nether as then, nor at any time sins, any charge
to that effect. Howbeit for
at I tooke it as for-
gotten, though I dealt not in publicke w
t
e states
of Holland, yet I used suche instance to
Barne-
velt
in privat, who is advocat of Holland, and
e
chiefest acto
r
in all suche causes, as he bothe assu-
red me of a short dispatche in
at mater, and
at
whatsoever had bin promised, by
e accord of
Meden-
blicke
, should be thorowly perfourmed. It was
in Aprill last
at he made me this promise, and
sins I have not failed to urge him upon it. But
still he alleageth,
at for
e important affaires,
w
ch
falle every houre, upon occasion of these warres,
that assembly will not hearcken to any privat mens
suites. His answear notw
t
standing doth not
vary from it self, but,
at it shall be accomplished,
whatsoever was agreed. For that I am absent
from
e
Hage,
where
Barnevelt
remaineth, I
can not so folowe this suite, as willingly I would.
But I will presse him w
t
my letters,
at if it be
not thereby ended, before my returne, it is but so
muche more patience. For I will deale effectually,
when I come to
e Hage, aswell w
t
e states, as w
t
e advocat, w
ch
are all of them in all their answers
a great deale more tractable, then they have bin
heeretofore, as I doubt not of bringing his mater to
conclusion. They
have
ever had opinion,
at Mons
r
Sonoy his speeches and endevo
rs
did never tend to
any other, but to incense her Ma
tie
against them.
I have also written from hens to
e
General states,
fol.172v
to make more hast in their answear to her Ma
ties
last letters, about
e mater of navigation, w
ch
they
signifie unto me is almost ready to be sent.
And
thus I take my humble leave. From Leewarden
June 29 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
